Merge pull request #150 from lookfirst/patch-3

point at unminified version

point at unminified version

screenshot: http://take.ms/s7eWt

I've found that source mapping isn't really a great solution (yet). In chrome, 

1. It keeps the file in a different tree `/source` in devtools than the actual source code.
2. I can't seem to set debug lines for files in the `/source` tree. Yes, I've turned on JS sourcemaps support, otherwise this file wouldn't be loaded in the screenshot at all.

The reality is that if I want the minified version, my build system will handle it just fine.

I know this may be a contentious change. You can reject this PR if you want.

Merge pull request #121 from websirnik/patch-1

fix: Prevent PhantomJS to pass iOS6 Safari check

Exclude PhantomJS from iOS6 check

PhantomJS has the following UserAgent string `Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X) AppleWebKit/538.1 (KHTML, like Gecko) PhantomJS/2.0.0 (development) Safari/538.1`. The check for iOS6 Safari returned `true` for this string. The function later fails on `ua.match(/version\/([\.\d]+)/i)`. This change stops PhantomJS UserAgent string pass the iOS6 Safari check.

fix: fixed cases where the config block would not be called

The config block would not be called if:
- defined multiple times (only the first 1 would be invoked)
- defined with an auto injected module: ['...', function() {}]
- defined after another component: angular.module().controler().config()

feat: you can now lazy load a component for an existing module

For example if you want to load LateCtrl for the module app (already defined & loaded), just do
```js
$ocLazyLoad.load({ name: 'app', files: ['js/LateCtrl.js']})
```
It will only register the new controller.
